intro: Jussiaea albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, white petals and slender stems. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, four-petaled flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Jussiaea albiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
